description:
doc/go1.1.html: document some of the library changes.
Still much to do, but this is a start.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/1/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/1/doc/go1.1.html#newcode143 doc/go1.1.html:143:
  • TODO networking is more efficient (known to runtime) missing
    • They're not required by the HTML spec, but it should be consistent. (I vote for leaving them out) also I realize this is a stupid comment because it's a todo https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/1/doc/go1.1.html#newcode325 doc/go1.1.html:325: Int type now has add the trailing slash after "big" here and for the rest https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/1/doc/go1.1.html#newcode435 doc/go1.1.html:435: The text/template package has a rewritten parser. seems like the parentheses are more important than the parser rewrite also is there an anchor heading inside /pkg/text/template that we can link to that demonstrates the use of parentheses? if not, i'll write an example and we can link to that https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/1/doc/go1.1.html#newcode440 doc/go1.1.html:440: The new function unicode/utf8.ValidRune reports whether the rune is legal Unicode code point, that is, in range and not a surrogate half. i think the "unicode/" part of the link text is unnecessary https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/1/doc/go1.1.html#newcode440 doc/go1.1.html:440: The new function unicode/utf8.ValidRune reports whether the rune is legal Unicode code point, that is, in range and not a surrogate half. should the fragment of this sentence after the first comma be a separate sentence?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/4001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/4001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode213 doc/go1.1.html:213: time: ParseInLocation, Timer.Rest, Time.YearDay s/Rest/Reset/ https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/4001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode277 doc/go1.1.html:277: database/sql: Ping Ping, SetMaxIdleConns https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/4001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode443 doc/go1.1.html:443: In the unicode/utf9 package, s/utf9/utf8/

https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/4001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046/diff/4001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode443 doc/go1.1.html:443: In the unicode/utf9 package, with UTF-7 and UTF-8, why not UTF-9?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, adg@golang.org, bradfitz@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=172ed4b6cbc9 ***

doc/go1.1.html: document some of the library changes.
Still much to do, but this is a start.

R=golang-dev, adg, bradfitz, remyoudompheng
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7729046

subject: code review 7729046: doc/go1.1.html: document some of the library changes.
